name: IELTS
purpose: To assess English language proficiency for study, work, or migration.

details.purpose_of_test: To measure the English language skills (listening, reading, writing, and speaking) of non-native speakers.
details.result_format: Band score from 1 to 9 for each section (Listening, Reading, Writing, Speaking), with an overall band score.
details.scoring_pattern: Each section is scored on a scale of 1 to 9, and the overall score is the average of the four sections.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the validity of the IELTS test? (Answer: 2 years)
Can I take IELTS online? (Answer: Yes, IELTS Indicator is available in some regions.)
How soon can I retake the test? (Answer: Anytime, but preparation is recommended.)

name: TOEFL
full_abbreviation: Test of English as a Foreign Language
purpose: To assess the English proficiency of non-native speakers for academic purposes.

details.purpose_of_test: To evaluate English reading, listening, speaking, and writing skills required in academic settings.
details.result_format: Score out of 120, with section scores for Reading, Listening, Speaking, and Writing.
details.scoring_pattern: Each section is scored out of 30, and the total score is the sum of all sections.
frequently_asked_questions: How long is the TOEFL score valid? (Answer: 2 years)
Can I take TOEFL from home? (Answer: Yes, TOEFL iBT Home Edition is available.)
What is the minimum score for TOEFL? (Answer: It depends on the institution, typically around 80 for iBT.)

name: PTE
purpose: To measure English language proficiency for study, work, and migration.

details.purpose_of_test: To test the English skills of non-native speakers in academic and professional contexts.
details.result_format: Score out of 90, with communicative skills (Listening, Reading, Speaking, Writing) and enabling skills.
details.scoring_pattern: Automated scoring algorithm that evaluates communicative and enabling skills on a scale of 10 to 90.
frequently_asked_questions: Is PTE accepted for immigration? (Answer: Yes, in many countries including Australia and New Zealand.)
How quickly can I get my PTE results? (Answer: Within 48 hours in most cases.)
What is the PTE validity period? (Answer: 2 years for most purposes.)

name: OET
purpose: To assess English proficiency for healthcare professionals.

details.purpose_of_test: To test the English language skills required in healthcare settings.
details.result_format: Grade from A (highest) to E (lowest) for each sub-test (Listening, Reading, Writing, Speaking).
details.scoring_pattern: Each sub-test is graded separately, and there is no overall score.
frequently_asked_questions: Is OET accepted worldwide? (Answer: Yes, in many countries like the UK, Australia, and the USA.)
What is the validity of OET scores? (Answer: Typically 2 years.)
Can I retake specific OET sub-tests? (Answer: Yes, you can retake individual sub-tests.)

name: Duolingo
purpose: To evaluate English proficiency online for academic and professional purposes.

details.purpose_of_test: To measure English reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills in a short online test.
details.result_format: Score out of 160, with proficiency levels indicated.
details.scoring_pattern: Adaptive test scored on a scale of 10 to 160.
frequently_asked_questions: How long does the Duolingo test take? (Answer: Around 1 hour.)
How soon are results available? (Answer: Within 48 hours.)
Is the Duolingo test accepted by universities? (Answer: Yes, by many institutions globally.)

name: GRE
purpose: To evaluate analytical writing, verbal reasoning, and quantitative reasoning for graduate admissions.

details.purpose_of_test: To assess skills required for graduate-level study, including analytical writing, verbal, and quantitative reasoning.
details.result_format: Score out of 340 for Verbal and Quantitative, plus an Analytical Writing score out of 6.
details.scoring_pattern: Verbal and Quantitative sections are scored on a scale of 130-170 each, and Writing is scored 0-6.
frequently_asked_questions: How long is the GRE valid? (Answer: 5 years.)
Can I take the GRE at home? (Answer: Yes, GRE at Home is available.)
What is a good GRE score? (Answer: Depends on the program, but typically 310+ is considered competitive.)

name: GMAT
purpose: To assess skills for business school admissions.

details.purpose_of_test: To evaluate analytical, writing, quantitative, verbal, and reading skills for business school applicants.
details.result_format: Score out of 800, with section scores for Quantitative, Verbal, Integrated Reasoning, and Analytical Writing.
details.scoring_pattern: Quantitative and Verbal sections are scored on a scale of 6-51, combined for the total score.
frequently_asked_questions: How long is the GMAT valid? (Answer: 5 years.)
Can I retake the GMAT? (Answer: Yes, up to 5 times in a 12-month period.)
What is a good GMAT score? (Answer: Around 700+ for top business schools.)

name: SAT
purpose: To evaluate readiness for college admissions.

details.purpose_of_test: To assess critical reading, mathematics, and writing skills for college admissions.
details.result_format: Score out of 1600, with 800 each for Math and Evidence-Based Reading & Writing.
details.scoring_pattern: Math and Reading/Writing sections are scored separately, and combined for the total score.
frequently_asked_questions: How long is the SAT valid? (Answer: Typically 5 years.)
Can I take the SAT multiple times? (Answer: Yes, most students take it 2-3 times.)
What is a good SAT score? (Answer: Depends on the institution, but typically 1200+ is competitive.)

name: ACT
purpose: To assess readiness for college admissions.

details.purpose_of_test: To evaluate English, math, reading, and science skills for college admissions.
details.result_format: Composite score out of 36, with individual section scores.
details.scoring_pattern: Each section is scored out of 36, and the composite score is the average of the sections.
frequently_asked_questions: How long is the ACT valid? (Answer: Typically 5 years.)
What is a good ACT score? (Answer: A score of 25+ is considered competitive.)
Can I take the ACT multiple times? (Answer: Yes, you can take it up to 12 times.)

name: APT
purpose: To assess college-level knowledge for high school students.

details.purpose_of_test: To evaluate college-level subject knowledge and skills for earning college credits in high school.
details.result_format: Score from 1 to 5, with 5 being the highest.
details.scoring_pattern: The score reflects mastery of the subject, with 3 or above typically considered passing.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the purpose of AP exams? (Answer: To earn college credits while in high school.)
How long is the AP score valid? (Answer: Valid indefinitely, but policies vary by college.)
Can I retake AP exams? (Answer: Yes, but only during the next testing cycle.)
